page.title: 06High Moor
page.content: The area around Badger Edge is very difficult land to farm , being so bleak and exposed, with the result that the keeping of horses, as in so much of the{marginal farming land}of the area, has been an increasing activity in recent years. The area around{High Moor}is the part that is the least pleasant as far as appearance is concerned. The scenery is scarred with a stone quarry and a civic amenity site (public tip). However these places provide some {local emloyment,}with up to 35 men at the quarry.Other local employers include the farm owned by Collings Brothers who employ young people on the Y.T.S. scheme and the Old Original pub. Most of the remaining land is divided into small fields of poor quality pasture for sheep and dairy
